sentences.english: Hoping that this time it will remain a lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 多希望这一次，它将仍然是一首摇篮曲。

sentences.english: A more child-friendly liner for the bassinet has been designed.
sentences.chinese: 摇篮曲线设计更加适合婴儿。

sentences.english: Both Asia and Europe are cradles of human civilizations and have long been associated with each other.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲和欧洲都是人类文明的摇篮，相互交往源远流长。

sentences.english: The mother was crooning a lullaby to her baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲正对着婴儿哼着摇篮曲。

sentences.english: Former minister of Ministry of Water Resources Zhang Zhenhuai praises the school as "the cradle of Yellow River technical leaders".
sentences.chinese: 水利部原部长杨振怀赞誉学院为“黄河技干摇篮”。

sentences.english: When Uncle Satchmo sings his lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 就在路易斯叔叔唱起他的摇篮曲时。

sentences.english: Chinese traditional Wushu is the foundation of modern Wushu development.
sentences.chinese: 中国传统武术是现代武术的摇篮和发展的基础。

sentences.english: My country Bassinet of east culture.
Hanzhengjie is the birthplace of Hankou, it is also one of the culture cradle of Wuhan.
sentences.chinese: 汉正街是汉口的发源地，也是武汉市文化的摇篮之一。

sentences.english: Yan’an is identified as the cradle of China revolution.
sentences.chinese: 延安被看作是中国革命的摇篮。

sentences.english: I think this song is a cradlesong that you seldom wrote before.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这支歌是你好难得写的一首象摇篮曲的作品。

sentences.english: The mother crooned her baby to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她低哼摇篮曲使她的婴儿入睡。

sentences.english: Did this device, which was built never to be cradled, ever warm up?
sentences.chinese: 这个设备，从来就没被建造在摇篮里，有过热身期吗？

sentences.english: They easily fill their small kitchen as Yang cradles his nephew.
sentences.chinese: 杨的小侄的摇篮很容易就填满那个很小的厨房。

sentences.english: Some moms swear their glider rockers are the only thing that gets their babies to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 一些母亲称滑动的摇篮床是唯一能让婴儿入睡的。

definition: to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
to hug/to cherish/within the bosom (of the family)/to embrace (also fig. an ideal, aspiration etc)
to sprout (lit. or fig.)/to bud/to germinate/germ/seed/bud
place of origin/source (of a war or a social movement)
hotbed/breeding ground/fig. breeding ground for crimes or sedition
